titles.title: Social Security Child's Insurance Benefit Restoration Act of 2000
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to restore child's insurance benefits in the case of children who are 18 through 22 years of age and attend postsecondary schools.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 7/18/2000--Introduced. Social Security Child's Insurance Benefits Restoration Act of 2000 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors' Insurance) (OASDI) of the Social Security Act to restore child's insurance benefits in the case of children who are 18 through 22 years of age and attend postsecondary schools.
